item.title: Gayle add a quote by James Joyce
item.description: "Welcome, O life! I go to encounter for the millionth time the reality of experience and to forge in the smithy of my soul the uncreated conscience of my race." -- James Joyce

item.title: Gayle add a quote by W. Somerset Maugham
item.description: "For men and women are not only themselves; they are also the region in which they are born, the city apartment or farm in which they learnt to walk, the games they played as children, the old wives tales they overheard, the food they ate, the schools they attended, the sports they followed, the poets they read, and the God they believed in. It is all these things that have made them what they are, and these are the things that you can't come to know by hearsay..." -- W. Somerset Maugham

item.title: Gayle add a quote by Michael Chabon
item.description: "Never say love is "like" anything... It isn't." -- Michael Chabon

item.title: Gayle add a quote by F. Scott Fitzgerald
item.description:
"And he could not tell why the struggle was worthwhile, why he had determined to use the utmost himself and his heritage from the personalities he had passed...
He stretched out his arms to the crystalline, radiant sky.
I know myself," he cried, "But that is all." -- F. Scott Fitzgerald

item.title: Gayle add a quote by J.D. Salinger
item.description: "I'm a kind of paranoiac in reverse. I suspect people of plotting to make me happy." -- J.D. Salinger

item.title: Gayle add a quote by Michael Chabon
item.description: "... But he believed that every great love was in some measure a terrible mistake." -- Michael Chabon
